page.title: 16CLAN FRASER
page.content: The Fraser clan is closely linked with this area and can be traced back to the 14th century,when a Fraser chief first added "of Lovat" to his title. Fraser is the most common name in the Kiltarlity area. The 12th Lord Lovat was involved in the intrigue of the Jacobite Rebellion of 1745 and was in fact the last person ever to be executed at the Tower of London.The original castle,at Dounie,was burned down at this time by the Duke of Cumberland's army,and the present Beaufort Castle was later built close to the old castle site. The 16th Lord Lovat,again a Simon Fraser,is remembered as the founder of the Lovat Scouts,who fought in the Boer war under the command of Lord Lovat himself.A memorial in the square in Beauly commemorates Lord Lovat and his Scouts for their gallantry.
